Articles.Content:
A long long time ago, in a small corner of this forum, there one existed a section known as "The Rocket Builders" section. It lived under the Spacecraft Exchange and it was a place where users could submit requests for crafts and have others complete the requests under "companies" they had made. These "companies" would have several members who would regularly create and post crafts when they weren't helping. However this section would occasionally come under fire from members of the section and in December of 2015, the leaders of this forum decided to abandon the section which the forum software transition that has been dubbed "The Great Forum Migration of 2015".

Since then, a large portion of the Rocket Builders mini-community has vanished... I know of several that have gone, such as @zekes. So I'm curious, who from the section, is still around? I know of a few people who are still around, such as @Mad Rocket Scientist, @Endersmens, @Spartwo, and many many others.

So, who's here?

Edited June 19, 2016 by ZooNamedGames
I started a company a week before RB was removed called CAKE Shipworks.

35 minutes ago, CAKE99 said:

I started a company a week before RB was removed called CAKE Shipworks.

Hm. Well at least you saw it.
Oh, Union Locomotive Works... I still have the SD40-2 that I made.
I was there.  With a small company, and relatively late.  But I did try to put the rocket builders in the internet wayback machine.

I remember it, and found it partly useful. I never got into the whole "company" thing, but it was helpful to have a specific place where I could post craft requests and someone would see it; EladDV made a B-52 for me once.
Still here! I'm sad that I never got to release my fully functional flying fist for the FIST! Company I had. :/

1 hour ago, Endersmens said:

Still here! I'm sad that I never got to release my fully functional flying fist for the FIST! Company I had. :/

Yeah I remember that... With BurnoutForzai.
I joined a little after the RB I thought the 2012 ( I think ) forum migration was the only one. I wish I was around in the RB.
